credentialsId.description: Credentials identifier for compute environment authentication. Requires existing cloud provider/HPC credentials. See [Create credentials](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-api/create-credentials).

orgId.description: Organization numeric identifier (read-only, set by system).

workspaceId.description: Workspace numeric identifier (read-only, set by system).

id.description: Compute environment alphanumeric identifier (read-only, generated by system).

name.description: Unique name for the compute environment. Must consist of 1-100 alphanumeric, dash, or underscore characters.

description.description: Description of the compute environment. Maximum length: 2000 characters.

config.description: Platform-specific configuration. Structure depends on the selected platform.

workDir.description: Work directory path for storing intermediate workflow files.

preRunScript.description: Add a script that executes in the nf-launch script prior to invoking Nextflow processes. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

postRunScript.description: Add a script that executes after all Nextflow processes have completed. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

head.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow head job.

compute.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow compute jobs.

environment.description: Environment variables to set in the compute environment.

nextflowConfig.description: Additional Nextflow configuration to apply. See [Nextflow config file](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#nextflow-config-file).

discriminator.description: Platform type discriminator (read-only, set based on platform selection).

preRunScript.description: Script that executes in the nf-launch script prior to invoking Nextflow processes. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

postRunScript.description: Script that executes after all Nextflow processes have completed. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

nextflowConfig.description: Additional Nextflow configuration content.

userName.description: Username for SSH authentication to the HPC cluster.

hostName.description: Hostname or IP address of the HPC cluster head node.

port.description: SSH port for connecting to the HPC cluster. Default: `22`.

headQueue.description: Queue name for submitting the Nextflow head job.

computeQueue.description: Queue name for submitting Nextflow compute jobs.

maxQueueSize.description: Maximum number of jobs that can be queued at one time.

headJobOptions.description: Additional options for the head job submission.

propagateHeadJobOptions.description: If true, head job options are propagated to compute jobs. Default: `false`.

discriminator.description: property to select the compute config platform

head.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow head job.

compute.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow compute jobs.

discriminator.description: property to select the compute config platform

region.description: AWS region where resources will be created (e.g., `us-east-1`).

computeQueue.description: AWS Batch compute queue for running jobs.

dragenQueue.description: AWS Batch queue for DRAGEN workflows. See [Illumina DRAGEN](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/supported_software/dragen/overview).

dragenInstanceType.description: EC2 instance type for DRAGEN workflows (e.g., `f1.2xlarge`).

computeJobRole.description: Role ARN to grant fine-grained IAM permissions to Nextflow compute jobs.

executionRole.description: IAM role ARN for ECS task execution.

headQueue.description: AWS Batch queue for the Nextflow head job.

headJobRole.description: Role ARN to grant fine-grained IAM permissions to the Nextflow head job.

cliPath.description: Path to the AWS CLI installation in the container.

preRunScript.description: Add a script that executes in the nf-launch script prior to invoking Nextflow processes. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

postRunScript.description: Add a script that executes after all Nextflow processes have completed. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

headJobCpus.description: Number of CPUs allocated to the Nextflow head job.

headJobMemoryMb.description: Memory allocation for the Nextflow head job, in megabytes.

head.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow head job.

compute.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow compute jobs.

fusion2Enabled.description: Enable [Fusion file system](https://docs.seqera.io/fusion). Requires Wave containers. Default: `false`.

nvnmeStorageEnabled.description: Enable NVMe instance storage. Requires Fusion file system.

logGroup.description: CloudWatch Logs group for container logs.

nextflowConfig.description: Additional Nextflow configuration to apply. See [Nextflow config file](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#nextflow-config-file).

forge.description: Batch Forge configuration options. [Batch Forge](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/compute-envs/aws-batch#automatic-configuration-of-batch-resources) automates the AWS Batch compute environment and job queue configuration required for deploying Nextflow pipelines.

type.description: Instance type. `EC2` deploys uninterruptible on-demand EC2 instances. `SPOT` deploys interruptible Spot instances (lower cost).

minCpus.description: Minimum CPUs provisioned in the compute environment.

maxCpus.description: Maximum CPUs provisioned in the compute environment.

ebsAutoScale.description: If true, provisions an EBS auto-expandable disk in the compute environment. Not compatible with Fusion file system.

instanceTypes.description: Comma-separated list of allowed EC2 instance types.

allocStrategy.description: Determines how Batch selects EC2 instances to carry out job executions. Default: `BEST_FIT_PROGRESSIVE` for on-demand instances and `SPOT_PRICE_CAPACITY_OPTIMIZED` for Spot instances.

imageId.description: Custom AMI ID to use for launching EC2 instances. Must be an AWS Linux-2 ECS-optimized image that meets the compute resource's AMI specification. If omitted, the latest approved version of the Amazon ECS-optimized AMI for compute resources is used.

subnets.description: List of VPC subnets to isolate EC2 resources from each other, or the internet.

securityGroups.description: List of security group IDs to define a set of firewall rules that control EC2 compute node traffic.

fsxName.description: FSx for Lustre file system name.

fsxSize.description: FSx for Lustre file system size in GB.

disposeOnDeletion.description: If true, delete AWS resources when compute environment is deleted.

ec2KeyPair.description: EC2 key pair for SSH access.

allowBuckets.description: List of additional S3 buckets accessible to compute environment.

bidPercentage.description: Maximum allowed price of a Spot instance, as a percentage of the on-demand price for that instance type. Spot instances will not be launched until the current spot price is below the specified cost percentage. Default: `100%`.

efsCreate.description: If true, creates new EFS file system.

efsMount.description: EFS file system mount point in containers.

ebsBootSize.description: Boot disk size for instances, in GB.

ecsConfig.description: Custom configuration for the ECS agent parameters used by AWS Batch. Appended to the `/etc/ecs/ecs.config` file in each cluster node. Altering this file may result in a malfunctioning Batch Forge compute environment. See [ECS agent configuration](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/developerguide/ecs-agent-config.html).

fargateHeadEnabled.description: Run Nextflow head job on Fargate container service. Requires Fusion file system and Spot instance provisioning model. Fargate is not compatible with EFS and FSx file systems.

arm64Enabled.description: Enable ARM64 (Graviton) instances. Requires Fargate, Wave containers, and Fusion file system.

forge.title: ForgeConfig

discriminator.description: property to select the compute config platform

preRunScript.description: Add a script that executes in the nf-launch script prior to invoking Nextflow processes. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

postRunScript.description: Add a script that executes after all Nextflow processes have completed. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

nextflowConfig.description: Additional Nextflow configuration to apply. See [Nextflow config file](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#nextflow-config-file).

head.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow head job.

compute.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow compute jobs.

fusion2Enabled.description: Enable [Fusion file system](https://docs.seqera.io/fusion). Requires Wave containers. Default: `false`.

zone.description: Google Cloud zone within the region (e.g., `us-central1-a`). If omitted, defaults to the first zone in the alphabetical list.

serviceAccountEmail.description: Service account email for IAM access to instances.

instanceType.description: Machine type (e.g., `n1-standard-1`). If omitted, a default instance type is used.

imageId.description: ID of the image defining the operating system and pre-installed software for the VM. [Ubuntu LTS](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/images/os-details#ubuntu_lts) Google public images are supported. For GPU-enabled instances, a [Deep Learning VM](https://cloud.google.com/deep-learning-vm/docs/images#base_versions) base image with CUDA pre-installed is automatically selected. Optimized, Seqera-owned custom images will be available in a future release.

bootDiskSizeGb.description: Size of the boot disk for the Compute Engine instance. `pd-standard` is used. If undefined, a default 50 GB volume is used.

discriminator.description: property to select the compute config platform

head.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow head job.

compute.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow compute jobs.

fusion2Enabled.description: Enable [Fusion file system](https://docs.seqera.io/fusion). Requires Wave containers. Default: `false`.

managedIdentityClientId.description: Managed identity client ID for authentication.

logWorkspaceId.description: Log Analytics workspace ID for monitoring.

logTableName.description: Custom table name in Log Analytics.

dataCollectionRuleId.description: Data collection rule ID for log routing.

discriminator.description: property to select the compute config platform

preRunScript.description: Add a script that executes in the nf-launch script prior to invoking Nextflow processes. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

postRunScript.description: Add a script that executes after all Nextflow processes have completed. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

sslCert.description: SSL certificate to authenticate the connection with the Kubernetes cluster.

namespace.description: Kubernetes namespace for workflow execution. Default: `default`.

computeServiceAccount.description: Kubernetes service account to use for Nextflow-submitted pipeline jobs. Default: `default`.

headServiceAccount.description: Kubernetes service account to connect to the cluster and launch workflow executions. See [Cluster preparation](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/compute-envs/k8s#cluster-preparation).

storageClaimName.description: PersistentVolumeClaim name used as scratch storage for workflow execution, e.g., `tower-scratch`. Must allow `ReadWriteMany` access mode.

storageMountPath.description: Mount path of the persistent volume claim used as scratch storage. Default: `/scratch`.

podCleanup.description: Pod cleanup policy after job completion.
podCleanup.title: PodCleanupPolicy

headPodSpec.description: Custom configuration for the pod running the Nextflow head job, e.g., `nodeSelector` and `affinity` constraints. Must be a valid PodSpec YAML structure starting with `spec:`.

servicePodSpec.description: Custom configuration for the compute environment service pod, e.g., `nodeSelector` and `affinity` constraints. Must be a valid PodSpec YAML structure starting with `spec:`.

head.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow head job.

compute.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow compute jobs.

headJobCpus.description: Number of CPUs allocated for the Nextflow head job.

headJobMemoryMb.description: Memory allocation for the Nextflow head job in megabytes.

nextflowConfig.description: Additional Nextflow configuration to apply. See [Nextflow config file](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#nextflow-config-file).

compute.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow compute jobs.

region.description: The GKE cluster region - or - zone

discriminator.description: property to select the compute config platform

location.description: Google Cloud location (region) for Batch jobs (e.g., `us-central1`).

bootDiskSizeGb.description: Boot disk size in GB for compute instances.

usePrivateAddress.description: Use private IP addresses only (no external IPs).

labels.description: Comma-separated list of labels to apply to Batch resources.

preRunScript.description: Add a script that executes in the nf-launch script prior to invoking Nextflow processes. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

postRunScript.description: Add a script that executes after all Nextflow processes have completed. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

headJobCpus.description: Number of CPUs allocated for the Nextflow head job.

headJobMemoryMb.description: Memory allocation for the Nextflow head job in megabytes.

nextflowConfig.description: Additional Nextflow configuration to apply. See [Nextflow config file](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#nextflow-config-file).

nfsTarget.description: NFS server target for shared storage.

head.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow head job.

compute.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow compute jobs.

fusion2Enabled.description: Enable [Fusion file system](https://docs.seqera.io/fusion). Requires Wave containers. Default: `false`.

serviceAccount.description: Specify a service account email address other than the Compute Engine default to execute workflows (recommended for production environments).

headJobInstanceTemplate.description: Specify the name or fully-qualified reference of a [VM instance template](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/instance-templates), without the `template://` prefix, to use for the Nextflow head job.

computeJobsInstanceTemplate.description: Specify the name or fully-qualified reference of a [VM instance template](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/instance-templates), without the `template://` prefix, to use for Nextflow compute jobs.

discriminator.description: property to select the compute config platform

allowBuckets.description: Comma-separated list of S3 buckets accessible to the compute environment.

instanceType.description: EC2 instance type (e.g., `t3.medium`). If omitted, a default instance type is used.

imageId.description: The AMI ID to use for launching EC2 instance. If omitted, the default [Seqera-maintained AMI](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/compute-envs/aws-cloud#managed-amazon-machine-image-ami) is used. Use Seqera AMIs for best performance.

preRunScript.description: Add a script that executes in the nf-launch script prior to invoking Nextflow processes. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

postRunScript.description: Add a script that executes after all Nextflow processes have completed. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

head.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow head job.

compute.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow compute jobs.

fusion2Enabled.description: Enable [Fusion file system](https://docs.seqera.io/fusion). Requires Wave containers. Default: `false`.

logGroup.description: CloudWatch Logs group for container logs.

arm64Enabled.description: Enable ARM64 architecture (Graviton) EC2 instances to run compute jobs.

gpuEnabled.description: Enable GPU instances to run compute jobs.

ec2KeyPair.description: EC2 key pair name for SSH access to instances.

ebsBootSize.description: EC2 instance boot disk size, in GB. If omitted, a 50 GB `gp3` volume is used by default.

instanceProfileArn.description: The `InstanceProfile` ARN used by the EC2 instance to assume a role while running. If unspecified, Seqera will provision an ARN with enough permissions to run.

subnetId.description: Subnet ID for instance placement (single subnet).

securityGroups.description: Security group IDs that control network access.

preRunScript.description: Script that executes in the nf-launch script prior to invoking Nextflow processes. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

postRunScript.description: Script that executes after all Nextflow processes have completed. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

headPool.description: Batch pool for the Nextflow head job.

forge.description: Batch Forge configuration mode properties. Batch Forge automatically creates Azure Batch resources during compute environment creation.

vmType.description: Azure VM type used by the Batch pool. Must be a valid Azure Batch VM type. Default: `Standard_D4s_v3`.

vmCount.description: Number of VMs in the Batch pool. When autoscaling is enabled, this represents the maximum number of VMs to which the pool can grow, and automatically scales to 0 when unused.

autoScale.description: Enable auto-scaling for the Batch pool.

disposeOnDeletion.description: Delete Batch compute pool when the compute environment is deleted.

forge.title: AzBatchForgeConfig

tokenDuration.description: Duration of the SAS token created by Nextflow. Default: `12h`.

deleteJobsOnCompletion.description: Automatically delete Batch jobs after completion.
deleteJobsOnCompletion.title: JobCleanupPolicy

deletePoolsOnCompletion.description: Automatically delete Batch pools after completion. Default: `false`.

head.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow head job.

compute.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow compute jobs.

fusion2Enabled.description: Enable [Fusion file system](https://docs.seqera.io/fusion). Requires Wave containers. Default: `false`.

nextflowConfig.description: Additional Nextflow configuration to apply. See [Nextflow config file](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#nextflow-config-file).

managedIdentityClientId.description: The ID of a [managed identity client](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/compute-envs/azure-batch#managed-identity) attached to the Azure Batch Pool, used by Nextflow to authenticate to Azure Batch and Storage.

discriminator.description: property to select the compute config platform

region.description: Target execution region. See supported AWS regions [under step 4 here](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/compute-envs/seqera-compute#create-a-seqera-compute-environment).

defaultDataRetentionPolicy.description: If true, intermediary files are deleted after 28 days to manage storage cost/usage.

head.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow head job.

compute.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow compute jobs.

fusion2Enabled.description: Enable [Fusion file system](https://docs.seqera.io/fusion). Requires Wave containers. Default: `false`.

nvnmeStorageEnabled.description: Enable NVMe instance storage. Requires Fusion file system.

logGroup.description: CloudWatch Logs group for container logs.

nextflowConfig.description: Additional Nextflow configuration to apply. See [Nextflow config file](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#nextflow-config-file).

forge.description: Batch Forge configuration options. [Batch Forge](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/compute-envs/aws-batch#automatic-configuration-of-batch-resources) automates the AWS Batch compute environment and job queue configuration required for deploying Nextflow pipelines.

type.description: Instance type. `EC2` deploys uninterruptible on-demand EC2 instances. `SPOT` deploys interruptible Spot instances (lower cost).

minCpus.description: Minimum CPUs provisioned in the compute environment.

maxCpus.description: Maximum CPUs provisioned in the compute environment.

ebsAutoScale.description: If true, provisions an EBS auto-expandable disk in the compute environment. Not compatible with Fusion file system.

instanceTypes.description: Comma-separated list of allowed EC2 instance types.

allocStrategy.description: Determines how Batch selects EC2 instances to carry out job executions. Default: `BEST_FIT_PROGRESSIVE` for on-demand instances and `SPOT_PRICE_CAPACITY_OPTIMIZED` for Spot instances.

imageId.description: Custom AMI ID to use for launching EC2 instances. Must be an AWS Linux-2 ECS-optimized image that meets the compute resource's AMI specification. If omitted, the latest approved version of the Amazon ECS-optimized AMI for compute resources is used.

subnets.description: List of VPC subnets to isolate EC2 resources from each other, or the internet.

securityGroups.description: List of security group IDs to define a set of firewall rules that control EC2 compute node traffic.

fsxName.description: FSx for Lustre file system name.

fsxSize.description: FSx for Lustre file system size in GB.

disposeOnDeletion.description: If true, delete AWS resources when compute environment is deleted.

ec2KeyPair.description: EC2 key pair for SSH access.

allowBuckets.description: List of additional S3 buckets accessible to compute environment.

bidPercentage.description: Maximum allowed price of a Spot instance, as a percentage of the on-demand price for that instance type. Spot instances will not be launched until the current spot price is below the specified cost percentage. Default: `100%`.

efsCreate.description: If true, creates new EFS file system.

efsMount.description: EFS file system mount point in containers.

ebsBootSize.description: Boot disk size for instances, in GB.

ecsConfig.description: Custom configuration for the ECS agent parameters used by AWS Batch. Appended to the `/etc/ecs/ecs.config` file in each cluster node. Altering this file may result in a malfunctioning Batch Forge compute environment. See [ECS agent configuration](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/developerguide/ecs-agent-config.html).

fargateHeadEnabled.description: Run Nextflow head job on Fargate container service. Requires Fusion file system and Spot instance provisioning model. Fargate is not compatible with EFS and FSx file systems.

arm64Enabled.description: Enable ARM64 (Graviton) instances. Requires Fargate, Wave containers, and Fusion file system.

forge.title: ForgeConfig

discriminator.description: property to select the compute config platform

allowBuckets.description: Comma-separated list of S3 buckets accessible to the compute environment.

instanceType.description: EC2 instance type (e.g., `t3.medium`). If omitted, a default instance type is used.

imageId.description: The AMI ID to use for launching EC2 instance. If omitted, the default [Seqera-maintained AMI](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/compute-envs/aws-cloud#managed-amazon-machine-image-ami) is used. Use Seqera AMIs for best performance.

preRunScript.description: Add a script that executes in the nf-launch script prior to invoking Nextflow processes. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

postRunScript.description: Add a script that executes after all Nextflow processes have completed. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

nextflowConfig.description: Additional Nextflow configuration to apply. See [Nextflow config file](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#nextflow-config-file).

head.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow head job.

compute.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow compute jobs.

fusion2Enabled.description: Enable [Fusion file system](https://docs.seqera.io/fusion). Requires Wave containers. Default: `false`.

logGroup.description: CloudWatch Logs group for container logs.

arm64Enabled.description: Enable ARM64 architecture (Graviton) EC2 instances to run compute jobs.

gpuEnabled.description: Enable GPU instances to run compute jobs.

ec2KeyPair.description: EC2 key pair name for SSH access to instances.

ebsBootSize.description: EC2 instance boot disk size, in GB. If omitted, a 50 GB `gp3` volume is used by default.

instanceProfileArn.description: The `InstanceProfile` ARN used by the EC2 instance to assume a role while running. If unspecified, Seqera will provision an ARN with enough permissions to run.

subnetId.description: Subnet ID for instance placement (single subnet).

securityGroups.description: Security group IDs that control network access.

discriminator.description: property to select the compute config platform

region.description: Target execution region. See supported AWS regions [under step 4 here](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/compute-envs/seqera-compute#create-a-seqera-compute-environment).

defaultDataRetentionPolicy.description: If true, intermediary files are deleted after 28 days to manage storage cost/usage.

head.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow head job.

compute.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow compute jobs.

discriminator.description: property to select the compute config platform

location.description: Google Cloud location (region) for Batch jobs (e.g., `us-central1`).

bootDiskSizeGb.description: Boot disk size in GB for compute instances.

usePrivateAddress.description: Use private IP addresses only (no external IPs).

labels.description: Comma-separated list of labels to apply to Batch resources.

preRunScript.description: Add a script that executes in the nf-launch script prior to invoking Nextflow processes. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

postRunScript.description: Add a script that executes after all Nextflow processes have completed. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

headJobCpus.description: Number of CPUs allocated for the Nextflow head job.

headJobMemoryMb.description: Memory allocation for the Nextflow head job in megabytes.

nextflowConfig.description: Additional Nextflow configuration to apply. See [Nextflow config file](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#nextflow-config-file).

nfsTarget.description: NFS server target for shared storage.

head.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow head job.

compute.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow compute jobs.

fusion2Enabled.description: Enable [Fusion file system](https://docs.seqera.io/fusion). Requires Wave containers. Default: `false`.

serviceAccount.description: Specify a service account email address other than the Compute Engine default to execute workflows (recommended for production environments).

headJobInstanceTemplate.description: Specify the name or fully-qualified reference of a [VM instance template](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/instance-templates), without the `template://` prefix, to use for the Nextflow head job.

computeJobsInstanceTemplate.description: Specify the name or fully-qualified reference of a [VM instance template](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/instance-templates), without the `template://` prefix, to use for Nextflow compute jobs.

discriminator.description: property to select the compute config platform

preRunScript.description: Add a script that executes in the nf-launch script prior to invoking Nextflow processes. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

postRunScript.description: Add a script that executes after all Nextflow processes have completed. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

nextflowConfig.description: Additional Nextflow configuration to apply. See [Nextflow config file](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#nextflow-config-file).

head.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow head job.

compute.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow compute jobs.

fusion2Enabled.description: Enable [Fusion file system](https://docs.seqera.io/fusion). Requires Wave containers. Default: `false`.

zone.description: Google Cloud zone within the region (e.g., `us-central1-a`). If omitted, defaults to the first zone in the alphabetical list.

serviceAccountEmail.description: Service account email for IAM access to instances.

instanceType.description: Machine type (e.g., `n1-standard-1`). If omitted, a default instance type is used.

imageId.description: ID of the image defining the operating system and pre-installed software for the VM. [Ubuntu LTS](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/images/os-details#ubuntu_lts) Google public images are supported. For GPU-enabled instances, a [Deep Learning VM](https://cloud.google.com/deep-learning-vm/docs/images#base_versions) base image with CUDA pre-installed is automatically selected. Optimized, Seqera-owned custom images will be available in a future release.

bootDiskSizeGb.description: Size of the boot disk for the Compute Engine instance. `pd-standard` is used. If undefined, a default 50 GB volume is used.

discriminator.description: property to select the compute config platform

preRunScript.description: Add a script that executes in the nf-launch script prior to invoking Nextflow processes. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

postRunScript.description: Add a script that executes after all Nextflow processes have completed. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

headPool.description: Batch pool for the Nextflow head job.

forge.description: Batch Forge configuration mode properties. Batch Forge automatically creates Azure Batch resources during compute environment creation.

vmType.description: Azure VM type used by the Batch pool. Must be a valid Azure Batch VM type. Default: `Standard_D4s_v3`.

vmCount.description: Number of VMs in the Batch pool. When autoscaling is enabled, this represents the maximum number of VMs to which the pool can grow, and automatically scales to 0 when unused.

autoScale.description: Enable auto-scaling for the Batch pool.

disposeOnDeletion.description: Delete Batch compute pool when the compute environment is deleted.

forge.title: AzBatchForgeConfig

tokenDuration.description: Duration of the SAS token created by Nextflow. Default: `12h`.

deleteJobsOnCompletion.description: Automatically delete Batch jobs after completion.
deleteJobsOnCompletion.title: JobCleanupPolicy

deletePoolsOnCompletion.description: Automatically delete Batch pools after completion. Default: `false`.

head.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow head job.

compute.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow compute jobs.

fusion2Enabled.description: Enable [Fusion file system](https://docs.seqera.io/fusion). Requires Wave containers. Default: `false`.

nextflowConfig.description: Additional Nextflow configuration to apply. See [Nextflow config file](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#nextflow-config-file).

managedIdentityClientId.description: The ID of a [managed identity client](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/compute-envs/azure-batch#managed-identity) attached to the Azure Batch Pool, used by Nextflow to authenticate to Azure Batch and Storage.

compute.description: Apply this variable to the Nextflow compute jobs.

fusion2Enabled.description: Enable [Fusion file system](https://docs.seqera.io/fusion). Requires Wave containers. Default: `false`.

managedIdentityClientId.description: Managed identity client ID for authentication.

logWorkspaceId.description: Log Analytics workspace ID for monitoring.

logTableName.description: Custom table name in Log Analytics.

dataCollectionRuleId.description: Data collection rule ID for log routing.

preRunScript.description: Script that executes in the nf-launch script prior to invoking Nextflow processes. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

postRunScript.description: Script that executes after all Nextflow processes have completed. See [Pre and post-run scripts](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/launch/advanced#pre-and-post-run-scripts).

nextflowConfig.description: Additional Nextflow configuration content.

userName.description: Username for SSH authentication to the HPC cluster.

hostName.description: Hostname or IP address of the HPC cluster head node.

port.description: SSH port for connecting to the HPC cluster. Default: `22`.

headQueue.description: Queue name for submitting the Nextflow head job.

computeQueue.description: Queue name for submitting Nextflow compute jobs.

maxQueueSize.description: Maximum number of jobs that can be queued at one time.

headJobOptions.description: Additional options for the head job submission.

propagateHeadJobOptions.description: If true, head job options are propagated to compute jobs. Default: `false`.

sslCert.description: SSL certificate to authenticate the connection with the Kubernetes cluster.

namespace.description: Kubernetes namespace for workflow execution. Default: `default`.

computeServiceAccount.description: Kubernetes service account to use for Nextflow-submitted pipeline jobs. Default: `default`.

headServiceAccount.description: Kubernetes service account to connect to the cluster and launch workflow executions. See [Cluster preparation](https://docs.seqera.io/platform-cloud/compute-envs/k8s#cluster-preparation).

storageClaimName.description: PersistentVolumeClaim name used as scratch storage for workflow execution, e.g., `tower-scratch`. Must allow `ReadWriteMany` access mode.

storageMountPath.description: Mount path of the persistent volume claim used as scratch storage. Default: `/scratch`.

podCleanup.description: Pod cleanup policy after job completion.
podCleanup.title: PodCleanupPolicy

headPodSpec.description: Custom configuration for the pod running the Nextflow head job, e.g., `nodeSelector` and `affinity` constraints. Must be a valid PodSpec YAML structure starting with `spec:`.

servicePodSpec.description: Custom configuration for the compute environment service pod, e.g., `nodeSelector` and `affinity` constraints. Must be a valid PodSpec YAML structure starting with `spec:`.

config.title: ComputeConfig

lastUpdated.description: Last update timestamp (read-only, updated by system).

lastUsed.description: Last usage timestamp (read-only, updated by system).

deleted.description: Deletion status flag (read-only, updated by system).

status.description: Current status of the compute environment (read-only).

409.description: Duplicate element. Existing run name and session ID combination
